title: Sex trafficking
context: §712-1202 Sex trafficking. (1) A person commits the offense of sex trafficking if the person knowingly: (a) Advances prostitution by compelling or inducing a person by force, threat, fraud, or intimidation to engage in prostitution, or profits from such conduct by another; or (b) Advances or profits from prostitution of a minor; provided that with respect to the victim&rsquo;s age, the prosecution shall be required to prove only that the person committing the offense acted negligently. (2) Sex trafficking is a class A felony. (3) As used in this section: &ldquo;Fraud&rdquo; means making material false statements, misstatements, or omissions. &ldquo;Minor&rdquo; means a person who is less than eighteen years of age. &ldquo;Threat&rdquo; means any of the actions listed in section 707-764(1). [L 1972, c 9, pt of §1; am L 1993, c 130, §2; am L 2008, c 147, §8; am L 2011, c 145, §3; am L 2016, c 206, §14]
